message.content:
<<<api>>>: String.split()
<<<code>>>: String input = "Look like this§0§25";
           String[] data = input.split("§");
<<<explanation>>>: The issue you are facing is not related to the StringTokenizer.nextToken() method, but rather with the String.split() method. In Java, the split() method uses regular expressions as the delimiter. The character "§" has a special meaning in regular expressions, so it needs to be escaped using "\\". 

To fix the issue, you can modify your code as follows:

String input = "Look like this§0§25";
String[] data = input.split("\\§");

This will correctly split the input string into a 3-long String array with the values "Look like this", "0", and "25".
